categories.title: Recent Updates and Features in ElizaOS

content.text: A new configuration option, ENABLE_TWITTER_POST_GENERATION, has been introduced to control automatic tweet generation. This feature allows users to enable or disable the generation of Twitter posts.

The KAIA Plugin has been added, allowing Eliza agents to interface with the KAIA Blockchain. This feature introduces an agent plugin to interact with the blockchain, with low associated risks and no required documentation changes.

The TON Plugin has been updated to include Ton Connect implementation, allowing connections with supported ton wallets via the Ton Connect protocol. It also supports batch transfers of Ton, Jetton, and NFT, and adds an action for interacting with Auction V2 and V3 contracts.

The Mina Plugin has been added, implementing on-demand creation of new Mina Providers and enabling token transfer operations. This feature is part of the Mina Hackathon and requires updates to the .env file.

The Okto plugin has been introduced, enabling integration with Okto's Web3 APIs and services. It supports portfolio management, wallet management, token information retrieval, and more, using Google OAuth for authentication.

Several bug fixes and optimizations have been made, including removing duplicated dependencies, fixing Docker and type issues, and updating the Supabase adapter to handle room and memory creation correctly.

The ElizaOS project is actively developing and integrating various plugins to enhance its functionality. Recent developments include the introduction of the KAIA plugin, which allows Eliza agents to interact with the Kaia Blockchain. This feature is considered low risk and does not require changes to the project documentation. Testing can be conducted using EVM-based private keys and the kaiascan API.

The Cronos and Conflux plugins are undergoing improvements in their test suites to ensure comprehensive coverage and proper error handling. The Cronos plugin requires enhanced testing for balance and transfer actions, while the Conflux plugin needs updates to address failing tests related to mock implementations and data type mismatches.

A proposal for a Taiko plugin integration aims to enable agent interaction with the Taiko L2 network, allowing for ETH/ERC-20 token transfers, balance checks, domain name resolution, and retrieval of on-chain activity metrics.

Issues have been reported with the plugin-evm, specifically with bridging and swapping tokens. Errors include invalid address formats and undefined properties during bridge actions. Users are seeking guidance on testing these functionalities on testnets like Sepolia.

A bug in the ElizaOS character file prevents overriding model configuration parameters. A proposed fix involves renaming parameters for consistency and ensuring the modelConfig object is included in the schema.

The CoinGecko plugin in ElizaOS is experiencing issues where it returns the Bitcoin price for all cryptocurrency queries and sends duplicate responses. Users are seeking solutions to these problems, including potential misconfigurations or compatibility issues.
Users are encountering Docker errors on Mac M1 when building ElizaOS, specifically related to TLS handshake timeouts when loading metadata for Node.js images.
There is a query on how to run ElizaOS with debug level logging, as the current method using pnpm does not seem to work.
Formatting errors have been reported in Twitter posts and replies generated by the ElizaOS Twitter agent, with users seeking solutions to correct the output format.

categories.title: AI Innovations in Web3 and Crypto

content.text: AI agent as Wallet is a promising hackathon idea, with some wallets like RewardyWallet already integrating AI features.
RewardyWallet is exploring AI capabilities, including adding spending limits with code snippets, as detailed in Safe's documentation.
Sui Agent Typhoon is the first AI Agent Hackathon on Sui, where AI meets Web3 automation, moving beyond memes and speculation.
A new set of AI tools and features is being developed, showcasing promising advancements.
An early preview of a crypto shark tank style game show is being developed for ai16zdao, an AI-led investment DAO. The show will feature AI characters and judges, simulating episodes in seconds.

The cryptocurrency market is experiencing a downturn, with several major cryptocurrencies showing significant daily losses. Bitcoin, the leading cryptocurrency, is currently priced at $98,334 with a 24-hour trading volume of $70,800,289,179 and a market cap of $1,951,377,569,318. It has seen a daily change of -2733.99.
Ethereum, another major player in the crypto market, is priced at $2,742.16. It has a 24-hour trading volume of $52,322,546,351 and a market cap of $330,636,858,598, with a daily change of -103.61.
Solana is currently priced at $207.89, with a 24-hour trading volume of $8,402,871,777 and a market cap of $101,261,474,960. It has experienced a daily change of -9.00.
The AI16Z token is priced at $0.3758, with a 24-hour trading volume of $19,826,348.44 and a market cap of $413,475,985. It has seen a daily change of -13.35.

categories.title: Challenges and Solutions in Open Source and Fair Launch Projects

content.text: The notion of 'free open source projects' often overlooks the expertise of the original developers and the financial sustainability required for ongoing updates. When these projects run out of funding, users may no longer receive updates, highlighting the need for mechanisms to ensure financial support.

Launching a 'fair launch' coin to fund long-term projects presents several challenges. Teams often end up with a small percentage of the token supply, leading to issues like lack of supply control, difficulty in satisfying equity expectations, and liquidity problems. These projects can also incur significant legal costs and face unrealistic expectations from traders. The open-source nature of these projects often results in people capitalizing on them without supporting the creators, necessitating a focus on sustainable relationships. Efforts are underway to balance the spirit of fair launch with practical mechanisms for building real technology, with a whitepaper in development.
Thanks to everyone who tuned in to DAOVOS #4! We’re back tomorrow with @BainanceLabs and @scanateam. Set a reminder and bring some questions.
DAOVOS #4 recording is available.
Five days in D.C. and the main thing I learned is that the government is about 1000x more business oriented and pay-to-play than the American public realizes.
This is serious business

categories.title: Recent Developments in AI, Web3, and Open Source Projects

content.text: Luke Farritor won a portion of a $700k prize for deciphering ancient scrolls carbonized by Mount Vesuvius.
The challenge with free open source projects is the lack of updates if the creators run out of funds. Solutions are being developed to address this.
AI agent as a wallet is a promising hackathon idea, with some wallets like RewardyWallet already integrating such features.
RewardyWallet is exploring AI integration with features like spending limits, as detailed in their documentation.
WAYE and ElizaOS partnered in 2024, focusing on building innovative solutions.

Launching a fair launch coin for long-duration projects poses challenges, including supply control issues, liquidity problems, and unrealistic expectations. A whitepaper is being developed to address these issues.
A new set design is being developed, showcasing promising improvements.
Sui Agent Typhoon is the first AI Agent Hackathon on Sui, merging AI with Web3 automation.
DAOVOS #4 was a success, with a recording available for those who missed it. The next session will feature BainanceLabs and scanateam.
The experience over the last four months has been both fun and stressful, with the two being directly proportional.
Development efforts are focused on new features and bug fixes, with contributions from 26 contributors.
A new interactive agent game show concept is being developed, allowing users to pitch their projects with AI-generated characters.
A form is available for those interested in pitching their ideas to AI judges.
